value.name: Plane with Indian passengers leaves France for Mumbai
value.description: A PLANE with close to 300 Indian passengers detained near Paris over suspicions of human trafficking took off on Monday (25) for Mumbai after being cleared

value.name: Rishi Sunak 'has confidence' in James Cleverly as pressure grows over date-rape drug joke
value.description: Prime Minister RIshi Sunak is under pressure to denounce the Home Secretary's remarks after James Cleverly joked about giving his wife a date-rape drug

value.name: Southampton FC's 5 most famous celebrity supporters
value.description: Famous celebrities such as Ed Chamberlin, Rishi Sunak, Iwan Thomas, Craig David, and Lucy Pinder are known supporters of Southampton FC. These celebrities have expressed their love for the club and have been seen attending games or writing about their support.

value.name: Sunak and Starmer share family festive traditions
value.description: Rishi Sunak has revealed that he takes charge of cooking the turkey on Christmas day, while Sir Keir Starmer heads to his local pub.

value.name: Israel-Hamas war 'not close to end', Netanyahu warns - as Gaza conditions remain 'catastrophic'
value.description: Israel's ground offensive in Gaza will expand over the coming days, Benjamin Netanyahu has warned, as attacks appeared to intensify on Christmas Day.

value.name: The weasel words of Cop28 can be easily twisted
value.description: Letters: It is well past time to find radical alternatives to this failed process, says John Foster, and Peter Allen backs citizens’ action

value.name: Rishi Sunak buys mince pies at King's Cross 'for key workers'
value.description: The prime minister was seen at King's Cross railway station purchasing seasonal treats, which were reportedly for key workers.

value.name: Tories facing growing election threat from Farage’s Reform UK

value.description: King Charles has used his second Christmas message to praise people's growing awareness of how we must protect our Earth.

value.description: Mr Hunt has been urged to consider a range of measures including a green stamp duty cut and a reduction in VAT on electric vehicle charging points

value.name: How this 'unprecedented death' in an ice hockey match could end up in court
value.description: When Adam Johnson died during an ice hockey match earlier this year, his club called it a "freak accident". Now police are investigating whether another player could have been criminally responsible.

value.name: Rachel Marsden: Western leaders are panicking after setting off a ticking time bomb
value.description: US President Joe Biden isn’t alone in being mugged by reality and by Senate Republicans insisting that he reduce options for asylum seekers as a condition of further fueling the conflict

value.name: How Rishi Sunak, Keir Starmer, Liz Truss and more do Christmas
value.description: POLITICO London Playbook rounds up the festive traditions of Westminster’s power players — in their own words.

value.name: Christmas Day rituals of Westminster
value.description: Victoria Prentis, attorney general: “I spend every Christmas Eve organising the village nativity with dogs dressed up as sheep, alpacas pretending to be camels, and a pony who is acting the part of the donkey. Hundreds of people come to see the spectacle!”

value.name: British home secretary James Cleverly under fire for making joke about date rape drug
value.description: Cleverly, 54, who met his wife in college and has two children, previously described tackling violence against women and girls as a personal priority.

value.name: British expats can get their right to vote back next month
value.description: Back in April, Conservative MP and Deputy Speaker of the House, Sir Roger Gale, who has for decades championed the rights of British expatriates, was informed that British expats would be given the right to vote for life ahead of the next general election in the UK.

value.name: Google: What were people in England searching for this year?
value.description: Temu launched in the UK in April 2023 and has become the UK's most downloaded shopping app with an estimated nine million users, according to Apple. The shop sells everything from apparel to electronics and allows consumers to bypass warehouse stores and buy directly from Chinese manufacturers.

value.name: The year of social media soul-searching: Twitter dies, X and Threads are born and AI gets personal
value.description: Musk revealed the X logo in July. It quickly replaced Twitter's name and its whimsical blue bird icon, online and on the company's San Francisco headquarters. "And soon we shall bid adieu to the twitter brand and, gradually, all the birds,” Musk posted on the site.

value.name: UK’s Parliament: What hinders it from being effective?
value.description: The members of Parliament were noted to have lacked participation and the backbone to challenge Sunak this entire year

value.name: Archbishop of Wales calls for Christmas peace prayers
value.description: The Archbishop of Wales has called on the public to focus on and pray for peace for those suffering this Christmas. Andrew John noted the struggles facing people across the world in "one of those dreadful years".

value.name: Quiz: Who said it - Rishi Sunak or Star Wars?
value.description: Try our special quiz to see if you can tell the Prime Minister, perhaps Westminster's biggest Star Wars geek, apart from the epic sci-fi film saga

value.name: The year that ripped the Tory Party apart
value.description: It was a timely warning from a man who had seen it happen before. Last autumn when MPs were on the brink of ousting Liz Truss as prime minister, George Brandis, the former Australian High Commissioner to the UK,

value.name: Margaret Thatcher would be 'horrified' by Rishi Sunak's Tory Party, says Ann Widdecombe
value.description: With the Conservatives facing another potentially damaging by-election after a recall petition against Wellingborough MP Peter Bone, and the party continuing to bicker over immigration, Rishi Sunak, the current occupant of Number 10, is struggling to ...

value.name: 2023 Politics Wrapped: How Much Of This Nonsense Do You Remember?
value.description: Nadhim Zahawi was sacked as Tory Party chairman after “a serious breach of the ministerial code” over his tax affairs. Sunak marked his first 100 days in office by being less popular at that point than his five predecessors (who made it that far). Labour headed into the year with a 26-point lead.

value.name: Met Office gives verdict on snow tomorrow after warmest Christmas Eve in 20 years - live
value.description: The UK has seen its warmest Christmas Eve in over 20 years after Heathrow hit 15.3C, making it the warmest Christmas Eve since 1997.

value.name: Rare Edward VIII gold medal to go up for auction
value.description: Mr Seton-Watson was awarded the prestigious accolade while a schoolboy at Winchester College, the alma mater of Prime Minister Rishi Sunak, to mark an achievement of distinction in Latin verse. “It’s made that much more special because it is a Royal ...

value.name: Beyond Paradise Christmas special teases exciting life change for Humphrey and Martha
value.description: For all of its whimsy and low-stakes action, Beyond Paradise's first season wasn't afraid to tackle some weighty issues, one of which was Martha and Humphrey's IVF journey. Sally Bretton's character suffered a miscarriage in the first episode following multiple attempts to get pregnant.

value.name: I watched the Beyond Paradise Christmas special and it should be available on prescription
value.description: I also love spin-off Beyond Paradise, arguably and perhaps somewhat controversially, a little more… Kris Marshall is iconic as DI Humphrey Goodman. His performance as the bumbling (but genius) detective has cemented itself in the history books,
